title: Evidence-Based Multimedia Language Instruction Design Short Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and general understanding of language learning
context.additional_context: Utilization of simplified multimedia tools considering learners' limited technology access (smartphone-centric)

learning_goals: Learners can apply five evidence-based multimedia principles (e.g., dual-channel processing, spatial contiguity) to language instruction design.
Learners can create text-audio integrated learning materials using smartphone-based tools.
Learners can design infographics that visually represent language learning content.

resources: Free multimedia authoring apps (Canva, Audacity, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
